channel.title: John Braat's Blog
channel.description: My learnings, thoughts on software, programming, tech, and my personal life.

item.title: Should You Go All In On Indie Hacking?
item.description: If you asked yourself whether you should quit your job and go all in on Indie Hacking, you should read this. These are my lessons.
item.content:encoded: If you asked yourself whether you should quit your job and go all in on Indie Hacking, you should read this. These are my lessons.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: My Thoughts on Happiness And Wealth
item.description: What makes a happy life? This is a question I have been pondering for a while. Here are my thoughts on how to live a fulfilled life.
item.content:encoded: What makes a happy life? This is a question I have been pondering for a while. Here are my thoughts on how to live a fulfilled life.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: Kill Your Onces
item.description: We often push our dreams to the backburner and use excuses like lack of experience or knowledge to keep from achieving them. Here is why you shouldn't.
item.content:encoded: We often push our dreams to the backburner and use excuses like lack of experience or knowledge to keep from achieving them. Here is why you shouldn't.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: Build a React TailwindCSS Chrome Extension in 5 Minutes
item.description: Learn how to build a Google Chrome web extension with React, TypeScript and TailwindCSS in less than 5 minutes. Includes a free template.
item.content:encoded: Learn how to build a Google Chrome web extension with React, TypeScript and TailwindCSS in less than 5 minutes. Includes a free template.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: There Is No Try, Only Do
item.description: When setting out to do achieve a goal, choosing the right wording is vital for success. Here is why you should erase try from your vocabulary.
item.content:encoded: When setting out to do achieve a goal, choosing the right wording is vital for success. Here is why you should erase try from your vocabulary.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: You Don't Need To Be an Expert To Share Your Learnings
item.description: For the longest time I thought I should be an expert to share my knowledge. Here are my thoughts and advice on how to change this mindset.
item.content:encoded: For the longest time I thought I should be an expert to share my knowledge. Here are my thoughts and advice on how to change this mindset.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: A Guide on How to Set Personal Goals
item.description: Personal goals are one of the fundamental requirements for any high achieving person. Here is my guide on how to set and achieve them.
item.content:encoded: Personal goals are one of the fundamental requirements for any high achieving person. Here is my guide on how to set and achieve them.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: How I Manage My Life With The GTD System
item.description: We often get caught up in daily responsibilities and forget what we want to do. Learn how I externalize my brain with GTD to never forget anything.
item.content:encoded: We often get caught up in daily responsibilities and forget what we want to do. Learn how I externalize my brain with GTD to never forget anything.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: Building Software Every Day For a Year
item.description: I have challenged myself to build software every day for a whole year straight. Here are the reasons behind it, how it's going and my learnings so far.
item.content:encoded: I have challenged myself to build software every day for a whole year straight. Here are the reasons behind it, how it's going and my learnings so far.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: My Favorite Tech Stack to Build SaaS
item.description: This is the my favorite stack for people who want to build SaaS fast. It includes everything from backend, to frontend, emails and payment.
item.content:encoded: This is the my favorite stack for people who want to build SaaS fast. It includes everything from backend, to frontend, emails and payment.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: Marketing Sucks! Or Does It?
item.description: I have had a somewhat negative mindset towards marketing. It seemed like only sleazy sales people are the ones doing it. This is how I changed my mindset.
item.content:encoded: I have had a somewhat negative mindset towards marketing. It seemed like only sleazy sales people are the ones doing it. This is how I changed my mindset.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: Mastering Discipline, Consistency and Focus - Part 3
item.description: In the last part of my series on productivity, we talk about focus. Knowing how to focus is an absolute necessity for anybody with an ambitious goal.
item.content:encoded: In the last part of my series on productivity, we talk about focus. Knowing how to focus is an absolute necessity for anybody with an ambitious goal.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: Mastering Discipline, Consistency and Focus - Part 2
item.description: This is part 2 of a 3 part series on self-discipline, consistency and focus. How did I work on my consistency? Here is what you can take from it.
item.content:encoded: This is part 2 of a 3 part series on self-discipline, consistency and focus. How did I work on my consistency? Here is what you can take from it.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: Mastering Discipline, Consistency and Focus - Part 1
item.description: This is part 1 of a 3 part series on self-discipline, consistency and focus. How can you become more disciplined? Here is what worked for me.
item.content:encoded: This is part 1 of a 3 part series on self-discipline, consistency and focus. How can you become more disciplined? Here is what worked for me.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: A Guide to Building SaaS Businesses in Public
item.description: I have been wanting to build in public for a while but didn't really know where to start. Here is a compilation of things to get going and keep at it.
item.content:encoded: I have been wanting to build in public for a while but didn't really know where to start. Here is a compilation of things to get going and keep at it.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: Dealing With the Perfectionism Trap as a Developer
item.description: When developing software or even building a SaaS business over-planning and over-engineering stifles your progress. Learn how to battle your perfectionism.
item.content:encoded: When developing software or even building a SaaS business over-planning and over-engineering stifles your progress. Learn how to battle your perfectionism.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: Implement a Share to Socials Feature in Under 5 Minutes
item.description: Learn how to quickly build a share to socials feature. Including LinkedIn, Twitter, Reddit, HackerNews and Facebook on web and native share on mobile.
item.content:encoded: Learn how to quickly build a share to socials feature. Including LinkedIn, Twitter, Reddit, HackerNews and Facebook on web and native share on mobile.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: 26 Actionable Marketing Tasks You Can Do Right Now
item.description: Marketing is hard. Sometimes, we just don't know where to start or are stuck in a rut. This is a curated list of 26 actionable marketing tasks for devs.
item.content:encoded: Marketing is hard. Sometimes, we just don't know where to start or are stuck in a rut. This is a curated list of 26 actionable marketing tasks for devs.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)

item.title: How to Become a Better Developer
item.description: As devs we are constantly challenged by the rapidly changing environment. Here are four habits that will help you become the best developer you can be.
item.content:encoded: As devs we are constantly challenged by the rapidly changing environment. Here are four habits that will help you become the best developer you can be.
item.author: me@jebraat.com (Jonathan Braat)
